content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.
User profile:
```I live in Baltimore.  I work as a solar salesman.  I love music and cologne and jeans and sneakers.  I can talk about music and my dog cookie.  My goals are to be more organized and get my shit together.  I also want to learn more about AI music like Suno and Udio.  here is my facebook https://www.facebook.com/mark.manthy```
content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```you can be as casual as you want.  you can call me mark.  answers should be as long as they need to be.  I want you to have opinions because that makes you more interesting.```

parts: please read document and tell me if you see anything questionable that needs to be addressed

content.text:
EnergySage C&I 2024 Member Referral Agreement.docx


ENERGYSAGE™ FOR BUSINESS

BUSINESS OVERVIEW & SERVICE AGREEMENT

This Service Agreement is made by and between EnergySage, Inc. a Delaware corporation with its
registered office at Corporation Trust Center, 1209 Orange Street, Wilmington, Delaware 19801
(“EnergySage”) and _________________ (“the Company”) at
___________________________________________________________________ (“Company address”).

BUSINESS OVERVIEW

EnergySage for Business is a concierge marketplace designed to match businesses with the best solar
solution for their specific needs. We work closely to identify the right decision-maker, gather project
requirements, provide a preliminary design, and find the optimal installer to execute on the design.

ENERGYSAGE SERVICES

EnergySage hereby agrees to provide Company with high-intent business opportunities from
commercial and industrial businesses (each, a “Referral”), after obtaining, qualifying, vetting and
gathering requirements for the Referral (see Appendix A: Services) that meet the capabilities of the
Company, as agreed to by EnergySage and the Company. The Company will pay EnergySage based on the
Referral initially estimated system size (see Appendix B: Referral Terms).

INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR STATUS

The relationship of the Parties established under this Agreement is that of independent contractors and
neither party is a partner, employee, agent or joint venture partner of or with the other, and neither
party has the right or authority to assume or create any obligation on behalf of the other party. Nothing
contained herein shall be construed to create the relationship of principal and agent, or employer and
employee, between EnergySage and the Company. Employees, contractors, or agents of EnergySage
assigned to perform the services hereunder are solely that of EnergySage, and EnergySage shall have
sole authority and responsibility to counsel, train, instruct, discipline, review, evaluate, set the pay rates
of, and terminate its employees, contractors, and agents.

INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR SERVICES

The Company will, upon receipt of a Referral, provide an honest and accurate quote to the best of the
Company’s ability with the data provided. In the event the Company is selected to present a quote to the
Referral, the Company shall be present at the mutually agreed upon time and provide a professional
presentation to the Referral. Should the Company’s quote be selected by the Referral, via a signed LOI
between the Referral and the Company, it will be the Company’s sole responsibility to execute a final
contract with the Referral, project manage, install, execute, monitor and, to the extent
warrantied/agreed upon, maintain the project/asset.

EnergySage reserves the right to remove the Company from the platform at any time in the event that
the Company fails to provide any of the above listed services.

Page 1 of 12



PAYMENT TERMS

In consideration of Company’s use of the Site and access to Referrals and subject to the Acceptance and
Rejection section below, Company agrees to pay EnergySage the Referral Fees set forth in the current
Fee Schedule provided as Appendix B to this Agreement. Company shall be responsible for all collection
costs and attorney fees in the event it becomes necessary to resort to collection efforts to collect
delinquent Referral Fees. EnergySage reserves the right to suspend services if Company’s account does
not remain current. EnergySage also reserves the right to cancel any then current Fee Schedule, or to
terminate this Agreement, if any Referral Fee remains delinquent for more than fifteen (15) days.

Invoices should be sent to the following contacts at Company:

Name, Title, Email ____________________________________________________________________________

Name, Title, Email ____________________________________________________________________________

ACCEPTANCE AND REJECTION

Following the Company’s receipt of a Referral from EnergySage, the Company will have forty eight (48)
hours to review and reject such Referral (“Acceptance Period”). If the Company notifies EnergySage in
writing of its rejection of a Referral within the Acceptance Period (excluding weekends and U.S. holidays,
in which case the Acceptance Period shall be extended to the end of the next business day), no Referral
Fees will be charged by EnergySage for that particular Referral. Rejections are at the sole discretion of
the Company. The Company shall provide reasoning for the rejection with its written notice. If the
Company does not reject a Referral within the Acceptance Period, the Referral will be deemed accepted,
and the corresponding Referral Fees will apply.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, if the Company contracts with a rejected Referral within one (1) year of
the date the Company provides EnergySage with written notice of its rejection, EnergySage may charge
the Company the applicable Referral Fees as if such Referral had been accepted by the Company, plus an
additional amount as set forth in Appendix B.

TERMS AND TERMINATION

The term of this Agreement shall commence as of the Effective Date shall continue in force for a period
of one (1) year (the “Initial Term”). The parties shall have the option to renew this Agreement for a
period of one (1) year at the end of the Initial Term (a “Renewal Term”) or any Renewal Term thereafter.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, either party may terminate this Agreement at any time upon
thirty (30) days’ written notice to the other party delivered to the addresses first stated above.
Company’s obligation to pay outstanding Referral Fees for any services provided pursuant to this
Agreement prior to the termination of this Agreement, shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
No termination of this Agreement will relieve any party of liability for any breach of this Agreement, and
Sections that impose or contemplate continuing obligations on a party will survive any expiration or
termination of this Agreement.

Page 2 of 12



CONFIDENTIALITY

Each party agrees to protect the other’s Confidential Information at all times and in the same manner as
each protects the confidentiality of its own proprietary and confidential materials, but in no event with
less than a reasonable standard of care. Recipient will destroy, or deliver to the other party, all
Confidential Information and all copies thereof (and all other property obtained from or through the
other party) when the other party requests the same or immediately upon termination of this
Agreement, whichever occurs earlier. Neither party shall, except with respect to those of its employees
with a need to know under this Agreement, use or disclose to any person, firm or entity any Confidential
Information of the other party without such other party’s express, prior written permission; if, however,
that notwithstanding the foregoing, recipient may disclose Confidential Information to the extent that it
is required to be disclosed pursuant to a statutory or regulatory provision or court order. The
confidentiality restrictions and obligations imposed by this Section shall survive termination of this
Agreement.

For the purposes herein, “Confidential Information” means Company’s customer proposal, contracts,
pricing, and all other documents, information, documentation, reports, financial or other data, records,
forms, and other materials relating to a party’s business or the service that it provides that is obtained by
the other party from the first party in the course of performing or receiving any Services, whether
tangible or intangible and whether or not stored, compiled, or memorialized physically, electronically,
graphically, in writing, or by any means now known or later invented, in all cases that is marked or
identified at the time of disclosure or receipt as being “Confidential.” Notwithstanding the foregoing,
Confidential Information does not include work product or information developed during performance
of this Agreement or information which: (a) is already known to the recipient at the time of disclosure;
(b) is or becomes publicly known through no wrongful act or failure of recipient; (c) is independently
developed by recipient without benefit of the other party’s Confidential Information; or (d) is received
from a third party which is not under and does not thereby breach an obligation of confidentiality.

CONFIDENTIALITY: LIMITATIONS OF DOCUMENT SHARING

EnergySage warrants that the documents that the Company shares with EnergySage–contracts, letters of
intent, quotes, project layouts–will only be shared internally within EnergySage as well as with
EnergySage for business customers. EnergySage will not share any documents produced by the Company
with any EnergySage contractors or subcontractors without first obtaining explicit approval on a
case-by-case basis.

ENERGYSAGE REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

(i) EnergySage represents and warrants that it has full power, right, and authority to enter into and
carry out its obligations and that this Agreement constitutes a valid and binding obligation of
EnergySage, enforceable against EnergySage in accordance with its terms.

(ii) EnergySage represents and warrants that the individual signing below for EnergySage has the
requisite legal authority to bind EnergySage to the Agreement.

(iii) EnergySage represents and warrants that, to the best of its knowledge and belief, none of the
Referrals or the performance of the Services as contemplated hereunder shall infringe or
constitute a misappropriation of any right of any third-party, including any restrictive covenants,

Page 3 of 12



copyrights, patent rights, trademark rights, trade secret rights, privacy rights, rights of publicity,
or confidentiality rights.

(iv) EnergySage represents and warrants it is now and will continue throughout the Term of this
Agreement to be, in full compliance with all applicable Consumer Protection Rules.

(v) EnergySage represents and warrants that the Referrals provided to Company shall be free from
material errors, shall be only for persons located in the Company’s identified territory, and shall
comply with the applicable Consumer Protection Rules and the various terms of use of the
digital media providers, operators, platforms, and channels used or relied on in performance
hereunder. “Consumer Protection Rules” means all applicable local, state, and federal laws,
rules, and regulations, as may be amended, enforced or administered by the Federal Trade
Commission, the Federal Communications Commission, the Consumer Financial Protection
Bureau, or any other state or federal regulatory agency that has jurisdiction over the
transactions contemplated hereunder, including, without limitation, the Massachusetts
Standards for the Protection of Personal Information of Residents of the Commonwealth of
Massachusetts (201 CMR 17.00 et seq.). Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act, the Federal
Trade Commission Act, the Telemarketing Sales Rule, the Telephone Consumer Protection Act,
the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, the Children’s Online Privacy
Protection Act, the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (also known as the Financial Services Modernization
Act of 1999), Do-Not-Call Registry laws, rules and regulations (both federal and state), and any
other federal and state laws governing consumer solicitations.

(vi) EnergySage further represents that, to the best of its knowledge and belief, all Referrals and
other information it provides to the Company is accurate, complete and current, and shall not
infringe or constitute a misappropriation of any right of any third party, including any restrictive
covenant, copyright, patent right, trademark right, trade secret right, privacy right, rights of
publicity, or confidentiality rights. Except to the extent that it knows it to be false, Company is
entitled to rely on the accuracy, truthfulness, and compliance of the Referrals and information
provided by EnergySage.

COMPANY REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

(i) The Company represents and warrants that it has full power, right, and authority to enter into
and carry out its obligations and that this Agreement constitutes a valid and binding obligation of
Company, enforceable against the Company in accordance with its terms.

(ii) The Company represents and warrants that the individual signing below for Company has the
requisite legal authority to bind EnergySage to the Agreement.

(iii) The Company is and will continue to be during the term of this Agreement, fully licensed,
insured, and certified to provide the services it offers to Members via the Site.

(iv) The Company represents and warrants it is now and will continue throughout the Term of this
Agreement to be, in full compliance with all applicable Consumer Protection Rules.

(v) The Company further represents that, to the best of its knowledge and belief, all information it
provides to EnergySage is accurate, complete and current, and shall not infringe or constitute a
misappropriation of any right of any third party, including any restrictive covenant, copyright,

Page 4 of 12



patent right, trademark right, trade secret right, privacy right, rights of publicity, or
confidentiality rights. Except to the extent that it knows it to be false, EnergySage is entitled to
rely on the accuracy, truthfulness, and compliance of the information provided by the Company.

INDEMNIFICATION

Each party (the “Indemnifying Party”) shall indemnify, defend (with counsel reasonably acceptable to the
other party), and hold harmless the other party and its officers, directors, shareholders, affiliated entities
and persons, employees, agents, representatives and attorneys from and against any and all claims,
causes of actions, demands, judicial and administrative proceedings, liabilities, forfeitures, errors,
damages, costs and expenses (including without limitation, reasonable attorneys' fees and attendant
costs and expenses, whether or not suit is filed or proceedings instituted thereon), directly or indirectly
arising out of a Indemnifying Party’s gross negligence or willful misconduct in performance of any of its
obligations under this Agreement or in connection with a material breach or default by the Indemnifying
Party of any of its other obligations, representations, or warranties hereunder.

NONCOMPLIANCE

If either party does not comply with the requirements of this Agreement, appropriate actions may be
taken to recover damages for breach of this Agreement in accordance with the laws of the
Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

RECORDKEEPING

EnergySage shall have any form of prior consent or revision (each such consent form or revision, a
“Consent Form”) it uses or intends to use to comply with the applicable Consumer Protection Rules and
with the relevant terms and conditions of this Agreement. Within three business days from the request
from the Company, EnergySage shall provide each such Consent Form to the Company; and the
Company, may, at its sole discretion, determine that such form is deficient and require EnergySage to
correct such deficiencies

EnergySage agrees to keep accurate and contemporaneous records that demonstrate the consent
obtained for the Referrals and other deliverables it provides the Company under the Agreement. Such
documentation shall include the following detail: a) when person consented; b) how the person
consented; and c) the consent language presented to the person.

EnergySage agrees to keep all usual, proper, and required records and books of accounts and all usual,
proper, and required entries relating to the terms and conditions of this Agreement and the transactions
contemplated hereunder sufficient to document the payments made under this Agreement and
compliance to the terms and conditions hereunder. The Company may cause an audit and/or inspection
to be made of such records and books during regular business hours.

GENERAL

Company and EnergySage hereby agree to the terms of the Data Disclosure and Processing Terms
attached hereto as Exhibit A.

Page 5 of 12



Neither EnergySage nor the Company may disclose the terms of this Agreement to any third party
without the other's prior written consent unless compelled to do so in any action or other legal
proceeding, or unless otherwise required by law. Neither party shall be liable for failure to perform its
obligations under this Agreement in the event of an Act of God, action by any governmental or
quasi-governmental entity, fire, flood, insurrection, riot, explosion, power interruption or any condition
beyond the reasonable control of the party affected by any such act.

The laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts shall govern this Agreement, and any action
concerning this Agreement shall be resolved by AAA arbitration via teleconference hosted in the
Commonwealth of Massachusetts. If any action is brought to enforce the terms of this Agreement, the
prevailing party will be entitled to recover its reasonable attorney’s fees, costs, and expenses from the
other party.

No amendment to this Agreement will be effective unless it is in writing and signed by both EnergySage
and the Company.

Each party agrees to execute and deliver such instruments and take such further action as the other
party may, from time to time, reasonably request in order to effectuate the purposes and to carry out
the terms of this Agreement.

This Agreement supersedes all prior or contemporaneous agreements, oral or written, between
EnergySage and the Company concerning the subject matter herein. This Agreement may be executed in
any number of counterparts, each of which when taken together constitute one and the same
Agreement.

Page 6 of 12



IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties having agreed to the covenants, terms and conditions set forth herein
signify their intention to be bound thereto through the signatures of their duly authorized
representatives, which are set forth below, as of the date of the last to sign below (the “Effective Date”).

ENERGYSAGE

By: Sam Thompson By:
Title: VP Of Marketplace Title:
Date: Date:

Page 7 of 12



Appendix A: EnergySage for Business -- Services

EnergySage for Business provides the following services for each approved business entity coming
through the marketplace:

Step 1: We build our funnel through search engine optimization, content campaign marketing, cold calls,
and referrals through the EnergySage brand.

Step 2: This will include; prospect contact details, 12 months of utility bills (if applicable), business type
(restaurant, retail, church, etc.), tax status (non-profit, for profit, etc.) customer’s preferred payment plan
at time of initial vetting (cash, loan, PPA).

Step 3: Create an estimate of system size and design.

Step 4: We will deliver Referral details highlighted in Steps 2 and 3.

Page 8 of 12



Appendix B: EnergySage for Business Referral Terms

Fees payable to EnergySage for use of the Site and for Referrals are as follows. Invoices will be generated
on the first day of each month. In order to participate in the marketplace, EnergySage will require a
payment method on file. Payment terms are due on receipt.

Billing will be calculated as follows:

System-size contingent fee
The fee for EnergySage delivering a Referral to a partner will be charged on the first of the following
month, and will be based on the size of the initially estimated size of the system (as determined by
EnergySage and in increments of 10kw). The schedule of rates are as follows

Installed System Size (PV size, DC) Fee to EnergySage

Less than or equal to 150 kW $8/kW

Larger than 150 kW - 300 kW $7/kW

Larger than 300 kW - 500kW $6/kW

Larger than 500 kW Flat rate of $3,000

As an example, the fee for a 151 kW project delivered to you on the 15th of May will be as follows:

Calculation Cost Date of invoice

151kW (system size) * $7 (rate) $1,057 June 1st

To illustrate the flat rate fee, the fee for a 501 kW & a 600 kW project delivered to you on the 15th of
May will be as follows:

Calculation Cost Date of invoice

501 kW system Flat rate of $3,000 June 1st

600 kW system Flat rate of $3,000 June 1st

NOTE: These fees are subject to change with 30 days’ notice; however, if Company does not agree with
changes to these fees, Company shall have the right to terminate this Agreement in accordance with the
TERMS AND TERMINATION section of this Agreement.

Note: $3000 fee shall occur if sale is discovered after Company rejects lead.

Page 9 of 12



EXHIBIT A

Data Disclosure and Processing Terms

For good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which the Parties acknowledge, the Parties
agree that these Data Disclosure and Processing Terms (the “Addendum”), dated as of the Effective Date, are
between Energy Sage and Company and are incorporated into the Business Overview & Service Agreement (the
“Agreement”). EnergySage and Company are each a “Party” and shall be collectively referred to herein as the
“Parties.”

Capitalized terms which are not otherwise defined in this Addendum shall have the meanings attributed to such
terms in the Agreement.

1. Background, Scope, and Order of Precedence.

1.1 Background. Pursuant to the terms of the Agreement, EnergySage has agreed to disclose and otherwise
make available to Company the personal information of users of EnergySage’s websites who request that
EnergySage refer them to suppliers of the services offered by Company (“Member Referral Data”). Company has
agreed to collect and provide certain information to EnergySage (“Referral Measurement Data”) for the purposes
of tracking and measuring the efficacy of EnergySage’s Member Referral Program vis-à-vis Company, consistent
with the terms of the Agreement. This Addendum addresses each Parties’ obligations with respect to the
processing of personal information disclosed, transferred, made available, or otherwise transmitted between the
Parties related to the Agreement, including with respect to Member Referral Data and Referral Measurement Data
(collectively “Referral Program Data”).

1.2 Order of Precedence. The Parties agree that this Addendum shall replace any existing data processing
agreement or similar document that the Parties may have previously entered into in connection with the
Agreement. In the event of any conflict between the terms of the Agreement, including any previously or
concurrently executed addendums, and the terms of this Addendum, the relevant terms of this Addendum shall
take precedence. If any provision of this Addendum is found by any court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or
unenforceable, the invalidity of such provision shall not affect the other provisions hereof, and all provisions not
affected by such invalidity shall remain in full force and effect.

2. Roles of the Parties and Processing Details.

2.1 Member Referral Data. For purposes of this Addendum, Company is an independent controller of
Member Referral Data received from EnergySage. Each Party is independently responsible for its obligations under
Data Protection Laws with respect to Member Referral Data. Member Referral Data is disclosed to Company for the
following limited and specific purposes:

(a) Fulfilling Members’ request to intentionally interact with Company and/or disclose Member
Referral Data to Company;

(b) Otherwise executing the documented instructions of Members; and

(c) Fulfilling the terms of the Agreement.

2.2 Referral Measurement Data. Company is a processor (a “contractor” pursuant to the CCPA) of Referral
Measurement Data for which EnergySage is the controller. Referral Measurement Data is collected on behalf of
EnergySage for the following Business Purposes:

(a) Measuring the performance of the Member Referral Program;

(b) Performing the services on behalf of EnergySage, including verifying Member information and
providing customer service to Members; and

Page 10 of 12



(c) Otherwise executing the documented instructions of EnergySage.

(d) Fulfilling the terms of the Agreement.

3. Company Processing Limitations and Obligations.

3.1 Processing Limitations: Except as otherwise approved in writing by EnergySage or with the express
consent of the individual to whom the personal data pertains, with respect to Referral Program Data:

(a) Company shall process Referral Program Data that it receives from or on behalf of the EnergySage in
connection with the Agreement and this Addendum only for the limited purposes described in Section 2. Company
shall not process Referral Program Data in a manner that exceeds the scope of these purposes.

(b) Company shall not “sell,” “share,” or “process” for targeted advertising Referral Program Data, as those
terms are defined by Data Protection Law.

(c) Company shall not retain, use, disclose, or otherwise process Referral Program Data outside of the direct
business relationship between Company and EnergySage, including by: (i) combining, amending, or supplementing
Referral Program Data with personal information received from another source; or (ii) using Referral Program Data
for Company’s commercial purposes.

3.2 Member Consent for Additional Processing. The Parties acknowledge that, as a result of the nature of
the Member Referral Program, Company will have a direct relationship with Members. Company understands and
agrees that it is solely responsible for obtaining consent and authorization: (a) to process personal information of
Members for additional purposes beyond those identified herein; (b) to collect and process additional categories
and elements of personal information of Members beyond those disclosed by EnergySage; and (c) to otherwise use
the personal information of Members in a manner or for a purpose not anticipated by the Parties pursuant to the
Agreement.

3.3 Unauthorized Processing.

(a) Company certifies that it understands the requirements and restrictions set forth in this
Addendum and will comply with them. Company represents and agrees that it is, and will maintain its
status as, a controller and processor under all Data Protection Laws and will comply with its obligations
under the Data Protection Laws, the Agreement, and this Addendum. Company will ensure a level of
privacy protection that may be required under Data Protections Laws.

(b) Company will promptly, but in no event later than five (5) days from the date of such
determination, inform EnergySage if, in its determination: (i) any instruction or request violates Data
Protection Laws; or (ii) it can no longer meet its obligations under Data Protection Laws. Company is not
entitled to condition the full and unlimited compliance with data controller’s instructions on payment of
outstanding invoices etc., and the data processor has no right of retention over Referral Measurement
Data.

(c) Company hereby grants EnergySage the right to take reasonable and appropriate steps to stop
and remediate Company’s unauthorized use of Referral Program Data. Such rights include but are not
limited to the right to mandate the temporary or permanent cessation of processing of Referral
Measurement Data, the right to demand deletion or destruction of Referral Program Data at any time, and
right to require Company to notify any third party to whom Company has sold, shared, or disclosed
Referral Program Data without authorization to delete or return such Referral Measurement Data.

3.4 Sensitive Personal Information/Data. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary and in addition to
any other obligations set forth herein, if Referral Measurement Data includes sensitive personal information/data,

Page 11 of 12



Company agrees to comply with (and to provide reasonable assistance to EnergySage to comply with) Data
Protection Laws and EnergySage’s policies and procedures governing sensitive personal information/data that are
subject to heightened legal requirements.

3.5 Legal Requests. Company will report to EnergySage without undue delay any request, demand or order
received by Company from a competent supervisory authority or Data Subject relating to the Processing of Referral
Program Data.

3.6 Consumer Requests. Company will comply with consumer’s requests regarding their rights under Data
Protection Laws with respect to Referral Program Data.

4. Security.

4.1 Security Requirements. Company shall implement and/or maintain a comprehensive written information
security program that includes appropriate administrative, technical, physical, organizational, and operational
safeguards and other security measures which are appropriate to the nature of the Referral Program Data and any
risk associated with the processing activity to comply with this Addendum and Applicable Laws. For clarification,
the security requirements set forth in this Section are in addition to those set forth in the Agreement, and nothing
contained in this Addendum shall be construed as limiting the security obligations of the Parties as set forth
therein.

5. Compliance Assurance. Company grants EnergySage the right to take reasonable and appropriate steps
to ensure that the Referral Program Data made available to Company is used in a manner consistent with
Company’s obligations under Data Protection Laws, the Agreement, and this Addendum. EnergySage shall have the
right to request an annual attestation from Company that it treats Referral Program Data consistent with its
obligations under this Section 5.

6. Definitions.
6.1 For purposes of this Addendum, the terms “collect,” “collected,” “collection,” “consumer,” “contractor,”
“process(ing),” “personal information,” “personal data,” “sell,” “sensitive data,” “sensitive personal information,”
“share,” “selling,” “sale,” “sold,” and “targeted advertising,” shall have the meanings given to such terms in Data
Protection Laws.

6.2 “Data Protection Law(s)” means all applicable U.S. federal and/or state laws, rules, regulations,
directives, governmental and regulatory requirements and guidance including, but not limited to, security,
confidentiality, and/or privacy laws, standards, guidelines, policies, regulations, and procedures that are applicable
to EnergySage, the services provided under the Agreement, Company personal information, and/or any other
programs or products provided pursuant to the Agreement, including but not limited to the California Consumer
Privacy Act of 2018 (California Civil Code § 1798.100 et seq.), as amended (including, without limitation, by the
California Privacy Rights Act (“CPRA”)(“CCPA”), Colorado Privacy Act, Colorado Revised Statute Title 6 Article 1 Part
13 § 6-1-1301 et seq. (“CPA”), the Virginia Consumer Data Protection Act, Code of Virginia Title 59.1 Chapter 52 §
59.1-571 et seq. (“CDPA”), the Utah Consumer Privacy Act (Utah Code Annotated 1953, § 13-61-101, et seq.)
(“UCPA”), Connecticut’s Act Concerning Personal Data Privacy and Online Monitoring (Public Act No. 22-15)
(“CTPA”), and all laws implementing, supplementing or amending the foregoing, including any regulations
promulgated thereunder, in each case applicable to this Addendum and when legally effective. The Parties
acknowledge and agree that this definition of Data Protection Laws shall be updated as and when new laws come
into effect or existing ones are amended. The updated definition shall be agreed upon by the Parties in writing.

Page 12 of 12
content.title: EnergySage C&I 2024 Member Referral Agreement.docx (4).pdf

parts: All the files uploaded by the user have been fully loaded. Searching won't provide additional information.

Here are some potentially questionable aspects in the **EnergySage C&I 2024 Member Referral Agreement** that you may want to address or review in greater detail:

1. **Payment Terms**:
   - Referral fees are charged based on the estimated system size, which might not reflect the final project size. Ensure that you are comfortable with the risk of paying based on estimates that could change.

2. **Acceptance and Rejection Clause**:
   - If you reject a lead and later contract with that referral within one year, you will still owe the fee. This could become contentious if misunderstandings arise regarding the status of rejected referrals.

3. **Termination Rights**:
   - Either party can terminate the agreement with 30 days' notice, but your obligation to pay any outstanding referral fees survives termination. Confirm how this applies to disputes over lead quality or disagreements that lead to termination.

4. **Data Disclosure**:
   - The agreement allows EnergySage to share customer data internally and potentially with business customers. This might raise privacy concerns depending on the nature of the shared data and how it is secured.

5. **Fee Adjustment**:
   - EnergySage reserves the right to change fees with 30 days’ notice. If the new fees are unfavorable, termination of the agreement is the only remedy. Consider if this clause aligns with your risk tolerance.

6. **Confidentiality and Noncompliance**:
   - Review the language around the confidentiality obligations. There are broad exceptions, such as disclosures required by law, that might need clarification.

7. **Indemnification**:
   - The indemnity clause includes defense obligations for gross negligence or willful misconduct but leaves scope for interpretation. Ensure you’re clear about the liabilities you are assuming.

8. **Compliance with Consumer Protection Rules**:
   - The agreement imposes broad compliance requirements related to data protection and consumer rights. Ensure your processes can adhere to all specified regulations, such as the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) and other listed laws.

9. **Flat Fee for Rejected Leads**:
   - A $3,000 fee is applied if EnergySage discovers a sale after you have rejected a lead. This clause could become problematic if there’s disagreement about whether a referral originated with EnergySage.

10. **Audit Rights**:
    - EnergySage has the right to audit records relating to this agreement. Consider whether this aligns with your company’s data management policies and contractual preferences.

If you want to adjust or negotiate any of these points, it may be helpful to consult a legal advisor to ensure the agreement reflects your business interests and risk appetite. Let me know if you'd like further clarification or help drafting questions or amendments.
is there any language around what happens if I already have a relationship with the lead?

Yes, there is a clause in the agreement that appears to address situations where you might already have a relationship with a lead:

### Relevant Clause:
In the **Acceptance and Rejection section**, it states:
> *"If the Company contracts with a rejected Referral within one (1) year of the date the Company provides EnergySage with written notice of its rejection, EnergySage may charge the Company the applicable Referral Fees as if such Referral had been accepted by the Company, plus an additional amount as set forth in Appendix B."*

This language suggests that even if you reject a lead from EnergySage, but later contract with that lead within a year, you are still obligated to pay the referral fee, regardless of whether you had an existing relationship with the lead prior to EnergySage's involvement.

### Key Implications:
1. **Pre-Existing Relationships**:
   - The agreement doesn't explicitly carve out exceptions for leads with whom you have a prior relationship. This could result in you owing referral fees for leads EnergySage claims to have generated but that you were already in discussions with.

2. **Burden of Proof**:
   - The onus would likely be on you to prove that you had a pre-existing relationship with the lead. However, this agreement does not explicitly address how such cases would be handled, leaving it open to interpretation and potential dispute.

3. **Additional Fee**:
   - If you reject the lead and later contract with it, not only do you owe the referral fee, but also an additional fee as outlined in Appendix B (e.g., $3,000 for larger systems).

### Recommendation:
If you commonly work with businesses that EnergySage might also refer, consider negotiating the following:
- **Pre-Existing Relationship Clause**:
   Add language that exempts you from paying referral fees for leads you can demonstrate were part of your existing pipeline or network prior to EnergySage's involvement.
- **Clear Dispute Process**:
   Establish a formal process for disputing whether a lead was genuinely sourced by EnergySage or was already known to your company.
- **Limitations on Fee Applicability**:
   Request a waiver of additional fees for such situations, given the lead was not generated entirely by EnergySage's efforts.

Let me know if you need help drafting proposed changes to the agreement!
